summary: This bill, the Helicopter Operational Versatility and Enhanced Readiness Act of 2025 (HOVER Act), mandates the Secretary of the Army to establish an operational experimentation program. This program will evaluate the military utility of optionally piloted vehicle (OPV) rotary-wing aircraft in various scenarios, including contested environments and multi-domain operations. The program will also assess cost benefits, develop new tactics, and inform ongoing autonomy efforts. The Secretary is required to convert at least three existing rotary-wing aircraft to OPVs, conduct testing in designated airspace, and submit a report to relevant committees detailing progress, findings, and recommendations.
